lines.text: [title card]
Mike Costigan and 'Spade' Allen weren't exactly thieves - but they had a habit of finding horses that nobody had lost
Am I seein' things - or is them million wagons on the square?

[to Lee]
My name and address is Dan O'Malley.
I must be goin' blind - fired three shots and only dropped two of 'em.
Zach Little - Editor of the Custer "Pathfinder" was half scotch and half seltzer.

[speaking of Lee]
I'm thinkin' three old terrapins like us ain't fit to take care of a gal like her - What our gal needs is a husband.
Leave it to us. We'll find a marryin' man if we have to shoot 'em.

[as they're looking for a prospective beau for Lee, they ome across a chinese man]
Not a chink. They get shot too easy.
I've just reached manhood.

[Sarcastically]
Then you better reach again.
Cleanliness is next to Godliness - that's why Saturday night comes before Sunday.

[as Hunter's gang closes in]
Well, pardners - I guess us three old sharpshooters is together for the last reunion.
Shucks! One good man could hold this pass against a whole army of men like Hunter.

[Sarcastically after Spade takes a rifle]
I said a good man.
Mike, your pants may be shabby, but they cover a warm heart...

[to Spade]
You and Mike go on - I'll stay.

[With cards he has taken from inside his hat]
We'll cut high card to see who stays.
All right but no trioks. This is a gentlemen's gane.

[after Mike and Bull draw, Spade draws an ace of clubs for himself]
Why you low down horse thief. You cheated.

[Mike and 'Spade' glare at each other but Bull shakes 'Spade's' hand and 'Spade' throws his ace away. Spade's last word to his friends]
Don't tell the little gal - let her think I made it the other way 'round.

[Mike realizes he won't be seeing Spade again and hangs his head, ovrcome with emotion]
Goodbye, 'Spade.' It's been a long, long trail.
Goodbye, Mike - You been a good partner...

[Before leaving Mike gives him his plug of chewing tobacco]
That oughta last ya.
[He and bull ride off]

[while in the mining shack and Hunter's men closing in]
I'll fool 'em - I won't die with my boots on.

[to a pioneer family just before the land rush is to begin]
Keep your plow! You'll find the real wealth of this land in the soil.

[to Hunter's men just before they are about to shoot him]
Hold everythin', gentlemen - I want to ask you one last riddle - positively the last - - Where was Moses when the LIGHTS WENT OUT?

[to Lee]
Guess maybe Mike and 'Spade' are callin' me - Don't ever be afraid o' nothin', Missy - because the three of us will be watchin' over you...
The years went on - the West was won - and those who came for treasure found it in the harvests of golden grain!
